LuHeGi's Blog

Flat UI Colors

2018/12/22

written by Luke Gilfoyle

Adding Colour to the blog

Today I have come across a nice website called FlatUIColors, which is full of really nice colour palettes. So naturally I decided to use one to add colour to this, once greyscale, website. When you navigate to this website, you will find there are different palettes for different countries. I decided to use the GB palette since that is where I am from, and it has a lot of blueish colours which are my favourite.

How do you use FlatUIColors?

Go to the website and choose a palette. Then you simply click which colour you want to use, and the website copies that colour to your clipboard. Then you go back to your code after hearing a delightful sound, and pate the selected colour into your CSS or what have you. At the top of the page there is a dropdown menu for you to choose which format you would prefer to copy the colour as; the default is the #RRGGBB hex pattern.

My favourite colours

My top 5 favourite colours from the GB Palette on FlatUIColors are:

  • Vanadyl Blue - #0097e6
  • Mizarine Blue - #273c75
  • Electromagnetic - #2f3640
  • Naval - #40739e
  • Nasturcian Flower - #e84118
